Bibliografía

Adorno, Theodor y Horkheimer, Max (2001): “The Culture Industry: Enlightenment as Mass Deception” en The Norton Anthology of Literary Theory and Criticism. Nueva York: Norton
Adorno, Theodor y Horkheimer, Max (2005): “The Culture Industry: Enlightenment as Mass Deception”. Los Angeles: UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television) Transcribed Andy Blunden; http://www.marxists.org/reference/archive/adorno/1944/culture-industry.htm [03/11/2011]
Allen, Graham (2000): Intertextuality (The New Critical Idiom). London: Routledge
Audi, Robert, ed. (1996) The Cambridge Dictionary of Philosophy. Cambridge: University Press
Bacon, Francis (2002): The Major Works including The New Atlantis and the Essays, ed. e intro. Brian Vickers, Oxford: University Press

Barker, Chris (2000): Cultural Studies. Theory and Practice. Londres: Sage

Benjamin, Walter (2001): “The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction” en The Norton Anthology of Literary Theory and Criticism Nueva York: Norton
Benjamin, Walter (2005): “The Work of Art in the Age of Mechanical Reproduction”. Los Angeles: UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television. Transcribed Andy Blunden http://www.marxists.org/reference/subject/philosophy/works/ge/benjamin.htm
Booth, Alison (1993): Famous Last Words: Changes in Gender and Narrative Closure. Richmond: University of Virginia Press
Borges, Jorge Luis (s.f.): “Del rigor en la ciencia”. [El texto y un video cuyo audio es la voz de Borges leyendo el cuento, se pueden encontrar aquí: http://elmundoenverso.blogspot.com/2007/12/del-rigor-en-la-ciencia-jorge-lus.html ] [03/11/2011]
Boros, Janos (1998) “Representationalism and Antirepresentationalism –Kant, Davidson and Rorty” Vigésimo Congreso Mundial de Filosofía. Paideia.Theory of Knowledge. Boston URL http://www.bu.edu/wcp/Papers/TKno/TKnoBoro.htm 04/11/11

Debord, Guy (1967): Society of the Spectacle Detroit: Black & Red
Derrida, Jacques (1976): Of Grammatology (trad. Gayatri Chakravorty Spivak) Baltimore, MD: Johns Hopkins University Press [El concepto de différance se explica en una conferencia que se puede consultar en línea aquí: http://www.jacquesderrida.com.ar/textos/la_differance.htm]
